name: Bitwise Operations
explanation: Bitwise operations work on individual bits. AND (&) sets bit if both are 1. OR (|) sets bit if either is 1. XOR (^) sets bit if exactly one is 1. NOT (~) flips all bits. Left shift (<<) multiplies by 2, right shift (>>) divides by 2. Used in embedded systems, graphics, cryptography, and low-level optimization. Essential for efficient memory usage and hardware control.

examples.problem: Check if bit 2 is set: value & (1 << 2)
examples.solution: Non-zero if bit 2 is set, zero otherwise
